Third Party API

This is a reference to the Verizon Cloud API. This site is meant as a reference for developers wishing to create clients that access Verizon Cloud data.

We have a brief tutorial that is designed to help you gain a minimal understanding of how to interact with the APIs.

Glossary

MDN Mobile Directory Number. This is a subscriber's phone number.
NAB Network Address Book. This is the front end system you will connect to in order to begin authentication.
WSG Webservice Gateway. This is the name of the application that is the front end of NAB.
ATP Authentication, Tokens, and Provisioning. This is the name of the service that handles authentication, tokens, and provisioning.
NAB Token This is the token used to interact with the NAB system. It is good for 30 days.
Refresh Token This is the token used to get a new Media token when it expires. It is good for 14 days.
Media Token This is the token used to interact with the Media storage system. It is good for 9 hours.
Etc... More services and descriptions go here...

Authentication

getAccountTokens This API is the start of the authentication and provisioning flow. It takes login information and returns a set of tokens to be used for other API calls.
getAccount This API is used to retrieve account information for hte subscriber. It takes a token as returned by getAccountTokens and returns data about the internal user ID as well as service level details.
SNC Config This API is used to determine where to find configuration information for your client.
Client Config This API is used to determine urls used to interact with the media system.
Refresh This API is used to get new tokens after the initial ones expire. It is meant to reduce load against the Verizon authentication system.
